revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{prefix|en|yester|sol|t2=Martian day}}, by analogy with {{m|en|yesterday}}. ===Adverb=== {{en-adv|-}} # On the [[sol]] ([[Martian]] [[day]]) before the [[present]] one. #* '''2001''', [[w:Mary Turzillo|Mary Turzillo]], "Mars is No Place for Children", in ''Nebula Awards Showcase 2001: The Year's Best SF and Fantasy Chosen by the Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America'' (ed. [[w:Robert Silverberg|Robert Silverberg]]), Houghton Mifflin Harcourt (2001), {{ISBN|9780151005819}}, page 61: #*: But '''yestersol''' he took Mother into the old middle-pressure greenhouse (the little one they built when they first arrived here) and got her involved in a long discussion. #* {{seemoreCites|en}} ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # The [[sol]] ([[Martian]] [[day]]) before the [[present]] one. #* '''2003''', Sue Vorenberg, "Mars Central", ''Albuquerque Tribune'', 19 December 2003: #*: "We'll basically be waking up in the Mars morning, which will be 47 minutes later each day, and uploading our commands from ''''yestersol''','" he said. #* {{seemoreCites|en}} ===See also=== * {{l|en|tosol}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=eelorssty|Tyroleses}} [[Category:en:Mars (planet)]] [[Category:en:Past]]
